alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Dickson; Hickman; Houston; Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 9:05AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dickson, central Cheatham, southeastern Houston, Humphreys and northern Hickman Counties through 945 AM CST... At 904 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles north of Dickson to 9 miles southeast of Bruceton. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dickson, Ashland City, Waverly, Camden, White Bluff, Kingston Springs, Pegram, New Johnsonville, McEwen, Burns, Hurricane Mills, Charlotte, Vanleer, Slayden, Bon Aqua and Pinewood. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 154 and 181, and between mile markers 185 and 187. Interstate 840 between mile markers 1 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for Middle Tennessee.
